title.narrative: EFFECTIVE SOCIAL ASSISTANCE

description.narrative: Output 1.1: The effectiveness of social assistance in reducing the vulnerability of children and their families is strengthened the revised national subsistence minimum is equity-based and child-friendly and the social model of disability is incorporated into relevant legislation., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children (Covid), Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Families with children, adolescents, and young people living close to or below the national subsistence minimum are more resilient (to economic and social deprivation, and stress) and they benefit more from equitable access to quality and inclusive social services and transfers

participating-org.narrative: DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH OF KYZYLORDA O
SPC FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL REHABILITATION

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.1: The effectiveness of social assistance in reducing the vulnerability of children and their families is strengthened;the revised national subsistence minimum is equity-based and child-friendly; and the social model of disability is incorporatedinto relevant legislation.

description.narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has resulted in significant expansion of social protection programs as well social spending in Kazakhstan, however, also revealed many gaps:, fragmentation in the social welfare sector, barriers in getting social payments ;due to limited digital skills of service providers and beneficiaries&39;, lack of connectivity and ;inefficient e-platforms ;that need to be addressed. UNICEF supported the Government to improve effectiveness of social protection measures to minimize both short and long-term socio-economic impact of the crisis. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021
